quote: In my many years of working with people, I have never seen things change by chance, you have to work it out yourself.... life really sucks but YOU have what it takes to change it.
author: Nkem Paul, The Art of Achievement and Fulfillment: Fundamental Principles to Overcome Obstacles and Turn Dreams Into Reality!
tags: goal-setting, personal-development, personal-growth, personal-performance, self-help, self-help-books, values-and-bliefs

quote: Embrace everything you put your hearts on... for you will surly achieve it
author: Runa Magnus

quote: Growth or stagnation? There is no in-between. Life always seeks more of itself and death picks up the slack.
author: Christopher Babson
tags: inspirational-quotes, inspirational-speaker, motivational-quotes, motivational-speaker, personal-development, personal-growth

quote: The leader acknowledges and eradicates the weeds in the garden, but keeps vision on the beauty they are creating and not on the weeds they are destroying
author: Christopher Babson, Breakout Presentations: Wow! People in Business and Life
tags: inspirational-quotes, inspirational-speaker, motivational-quotes, motivational-speaker, personal-development, personal-growth

quote: Success takes many forms. Most people strive for something unattainable without realizing that it's already theirs.
author: Lada Ray

quote: I understood that it was time to quit postponing the embracing of my own potential. There was nothing more I needed to do to be worthy enough – and any other excuse I could muster to explain why I couldn’t step up right away – was simply that… an excuse.
author: Janet Louise Stephenson

quote: Cheap people often are not very happy because they love money more than they love their families
author: Celso Cukierkorn, Secrets of Jewish Wealth Revealed!

quote: As long as I keep fighting every day, I know my dreams will happen. Most often, our dreams will not unfold exactly the way we expect them to, but if we keep working hard, our dreams WILL happen as long as we BELIEVE in them and in ourselves. This is called having faith, and it is a very important component of success!”-Naima Mora
author: Naima Mora, Naima Mora Model Behavior

quote: If you don’t know exactly where you are going (and why),that is exactly where you will end up.
author: Christopher Babson
tags: inspirational-quotes, inspirational-speaker, motivational-quotes, motivational-speaker, personal-development, personal-growth

quote: Living a fulfilling relationship requires courage, nakedness and absolute fearlessness.
author: Liliane Mavridara

quote: If you don't know exactly what you want, that is exactly what you will get.
author: Christopher Babson

quote: If you are HUMAN, then the limit of what you can do, what you learn, what you can experience HAS NOT YET BEEN REACHED.
author: Silvia Hartmann

quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you were born without wings, do nothing to prevent them from growing.
author: Coco Chanel
tags: accomplishment, aspirations, drive, flying, goals, wings

quote: Dreaming about being an actress, is more exciting then being one.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Whenever you want to achieve something, keep your eyes open, concentrate and make sure you know exactly what it is you want. No one can hit their target with their eyes closed.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Devil and Miss Prym

quote: A goal is not always meant to be reached, it often serves simply as something to aim at.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
author: Karen Lamb

quote: Everybody said, "Follow your heart". I did, it got broken
author: Agatha Christie
tags: broken-dreams, failure, failures, goals, heartbreak, rejection, rejections

quote: If you don't know where you are going,you'll end up someplace else.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

quote: If you're trying to be miserable, it's important you don't have any goals. No school goals, personal goals, family goals. Your only objective each day should be to inhale and exhale for sixteen hours before you go to bed again. Don't read anything informative, don't listen to anything useful, don't do anything productive. If you start achieving goals, you might start to feel a sense of excitement, then you might want to set another goal, and then your miserable mornings are through. To maintain your misery, the idea of crossing off your goals should never cross your mind.
author: John Bytheway, How to Be Totally Miserable

quote: When you reach for the stars, you are reaching for the farthest thing out there. When you reach deep into yourself, it is the same thing, but in the opposite direction. If you reach in both directions, you will have spanned the universe.
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration
tags: aim, aim-high, deep, effort, far-reaching, goal, goals, journey, limits, narrow, range, reach, reach-out, reaching-out, stars, trip, universe, wide

quote: If you're bored with life, if you don't get up every morning with a burning desire to do things, you don't have enough goals.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: People will kill you. Over time. They will shave out every last morsel of fun in you with little, harmless sounding phrases that people uses every day, like: 'Be realis
author: Dylan Moran

quote: The greatest battles of life are fought out daily in the silent chambers of the soul.
author: David O. McKay

quote: If you want to be a grocer, or a general, or a politician, or a judge, you will invariably become it; that is your punishment. If you never know what you want to be, if you live what some might call the dynamic life but what I will call the artistic life, if each day you are unsure of who you are and what you know you will never become anything, and that is your reward.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: ...it's very much like your trying to reach infinity. You know that it's there, you just don't know where-but just because you can never reach it doesn't mean that it's not worth looking for.
author: Norton Juster, The Phantom Tollbooth

quote: Be practical as well as generous in your ideals. Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The hippies wanted peace and love. We wanted Ferraris, blondes and switchblades.
author: Alice Cooper

quote: I’ve worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down, and I will not let myself down.
author: Mia Hamm

quote: Disappointment is really just a term for our refusal to look on the bright side.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
tags: disappointment, discouragement, failure, goals, optimism, pessimism, richelle, richelle-goodrich, stubbornness, trying

quote: I come in a world of iron...to make a world of gold
author: Dale Wasserman, Man of La Mancha
tags: don-quixote, generosity, giving, goals, goals-in-life, heroism, life, life-purpose, man-of-la-mancha, selflessness

quote: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Patience is not passive waiting. Patience is active acceptance of the process required to attain your goals and dreams.
author: Ray A. Davis

quote: If you're going to do something, strive to do it better than anyone else. Do it all the way. If you're going to half-ass it, why bother?
author: Ashly Lorenzana
tags: accomplishment, effort, extreme, goals, life, performance, standards, superior

quote: I do know that when I am 60, I should be attempting to achieve different personal goals than those which had priority at age 20.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: If you don't have a well-thought out dream, you can start by figuring out where you want to go. If you cannot see yourself fairly or accurately represented in the community you live (from restaurants to department stores to clothing choices to conversations at the dinner table) and nothing there makes you feel awake or alive, I suggest you start doing some research on some other communities.
author: Kelly Cutrone

quote: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: It must be borne in mind that the tragedy of life doesn’t lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach. It isn’t a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled, but it is a calamity not to dream. It is not a disaster to be unable to capture your ideal, but it is a disaster to have no ideal to capture. It is not a disgrace not to reach the stars, but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for. Not failure, but low aim is sin.
author: Benjamin Elijah Mays

quote: But you might as well bid a man struggling in the water, rest within arm's length of the shore! I must reach it first, and then I'll rest.
author: Emily Brontë, Wuthering Heights

quote: Don't let your plans or goals become more important than yourself, or the ones you care about! :)
author: José N. Harris, MI VIDA: A Story of Faith, Hope and Love

quote: Are you aware that rushing toward a goal is a sublimated death wish? It's no coincidence we call them 'deadlines.
author: Tom Robbins, Half Asleep in Frog Pajamas

quote: There is one other error in the Gondsman's line of resoning, I believe, on ap urely emotional level. If machines replace achievement, then to what will people aspire? And who are we, truly, without such goals? Beware the engineers of society, I say, who would make everyone in all the world equal. Opportunity should be equal, must be equal, but achievement must remain individual.
author: R.A. Salvatore, Streams of Silver

quote: It is a paradoxical but profoundly true and important principle of life that the most likely way to reach a goal is to be aiming not at that goal itself but at some more ambitious goal beyond it.
author: Arnold Joseph Toynbee

quote: I should and can play better. That is going to be the challenge for me.
author: Andrew Strauss

quote: Scorpions are quite ruthless, you know. That is why Artemis bid one of them to kill her foe Orion. And as a reward she set the scorpion on up in the sky. I'm not ruthless. I merely do whatever it takes to achive my goalsThat's not ruthless?
author: Lisa Kleypas, Tempt Me at Twilight

quote: If you don’t take the time to get really clear about exactly what it is you’re trying to accomplish, then you’re forever doomed to spend your life achieving the goals of those who do.
author: Steve Pavlina

quote: A desire presupposes the possibility of action to achieve it
author: action presupposes a goal that is worth achieving.

quote: A goal ensures progress. But one gets much further without a goal.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A boat is always safe in the harbor, but that's not what boats are built for.
author: Katie Couric, The Best Advice I Ever Got: Lessons from Extraordinary Lives

quote: Life is as simple as these three questions: What do I want? Why do I want it? And, how will I achieve it?
author: Shannon L. Alder
tags: choices, decisions, goals, life-purpose-101, life-questions, priorities, questions, questions-in-life, simple-life, staying-positive-university

quote: A man has to have goals - for a day, for a lifetime - and that was mine, to have people say, 'There goes Ted Williams, the greatest hitter who ever lived.
author: Ted Willams

quote: To persist with a goal, you must treasure the dream more than the costs of sacrifice to attain it.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
tags: aim, cost, goals, persistence, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sacrifice

quote: The trouble with not having a goal is that you can spend your life running up and down the field and never score.
author: Bill Copeland

quote: Your ultimate goal should be partners with your ultimate fear.
author: Lionel Suggs

quote: When you could do anything, what you decide to do is important.
author: Neal R. Voron

quote: If you're not honest about what you want, you're never going to get anywhere.
author: Sara Winters, Hooked

quote: I love the challenge of starting at zero every day and seeing how much I can accomplish.
author: Martha Stewart

quote: CHAPTER VIConcerning New Principalities Which Are Acquired By One's Own Arms And AbilityLET no one be surprised if, in speaking of entirely new principalities as I shall do, I adduce the highest examples both of prince and of state; because men, walking almost always in paths beaten by others, and following by imitation their deeds, are yet unable to keep entirely to the ways of others or attain to the power of those they imitate. A wise man ought always to follow the paths beaten by great men, and to imitate those who have been supreme, so that if his ability does not equal theirs, at least it will savour of it. Let him act like the clever archers who, designing to hit the mark which yet appears too far distant, and knowing the limits to which the strength of their bow attains, take aim much higher than the mark, not to reach by their strength or arrow to so great a height, but to be able with the aid of so high an aim to hit the mark they wish to reach.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli, The Prince
tags: ability, aim, example, followers, goal, goals, path, reach, vision

quote: I don't want to see it anymore. It's lousy. And it's a cheat. You build it all around something... set yourself on something... and then you don't want it. Isn't it too bad the great truths are all such lies?
author: Stephen King, The Long Walk

quote: And I was remembering that time in our lives together, the time of those ritual walks. I was remembering the way it feels at just that moment when you begin to turn, when you’re poised exactly between the things in life you want to do and those you need to do, and it seems for a few blessed seconds that they are all going to be the same.
author: Sue Miller, While I Was Gone

quote: Common aim is stronger than blood.
author: G.I. Gurdjieff

quote: When teachers doubt your potential, show them how wrong they truly are.
author: Ace Antonio Hall
tags: achieve, believe-in-yourself, goals, persistence, students, teachers

quote: The More Important Your Cheese Is To You The More You Want To Hold On To It.
author: Spencer Johnson, Who Moved My Cheese?

quote: What matters most with any regimen, whether it's to lose weight or stop drinking or smoking, is your willingness to seek help and your desire to say 'no more.
author: Ewan McGregor

quote: Undoubtedly, our weariness is not based on the fact that we’re running. Rather, our weariness is all too frequently based on the fact that many of the things that we’re running from are the very things we should be running to.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: direction, fatigued, flee, flight, goals, run, running, tired, weariness, weary, withdraw, withdrawal

quote: You must really want to win with all of your heart! Plan your race
author: do not ever get side tracked. Focus on your goal - “the finishing line”!
tags: Lucas Remmerswaal, 13 Habits.com the Tale of Tortoise Buffett and Trader Hare

quote: Developing and implementing IT governance design effectiveness and efficiency can be a multidirectional, interactive, iterative, and adaptive process.
author: Robert E.  Davis, IT Auditing: IT Governance
tags: decision-making, feedback-control, goals, internal-control-systems, itg, management, monitoring, objectives, organizing, planning, policy-enforcement, policy-formation

quote: Remember if you write, write, write, you can never be wrong."---Stephanie Skeem Author of Flotsam
author: Stephanie Skeem

quote: ...By the time I would finish school I'll be fifty? He smiled."You're going to be fifty anyhow
author: Edith Eva Eger, The Choice: Embrace the Possible

quote: You can become anything you put your mind to. Just make sure it's worth a read.
author: Andrew-Knox B Kaniki

quote: Don't waste time with people who waste time.
author: Keesya Hill-Jones, The Protector

quote: Challenge yourself to do things you’ve never done before. Your success lies not in perfect outcomes, but in braving the courage, in believing in yourself enough to just try. There is absolutely no shame in making mistakes, or even falling on your face. It’s all part of being alive and being a human being. Don’t be discouraged to try again or to try something new. Keep expanding your experiences, keep growing. This life, this day is short and waiting for you to seize it! Carpe diem!
author: Akiroq Brost

quote: Like everyone, I have my challenges—but they sure don’t have me.
author: Alex Staniforth, Icefall: The True Story of a Teenager on a Mission to the Top of the World
tags: adversity, challenges, goals, life, obstacles, setbacks

quote: It’s not about getting out of your comfort zone to reach your goal. It's about widening your comfort zone so far that your goal fits comfortably inside. Once you do that, hitting your goals will be like hitting 3s for Steph Curry.
author: Richie Norton
tags: basketball, comfort-zone, entrepreneurship, goal-setting, goals, productivity, richie-norton, steph-curry

quote: ‪Widen your comfort zone so your goal fits comfortably inside. Do and you’ll hit goals like Steph Curry hits 3s.‬
author: Richie Norton

quote: Act as if' means to apply action. 'Faking it' means to be fraudulent. Don't miss construe the two. 'Acting as if' means you are asserting yourself in an action that will manifest in time, action and belief. Action equal outcome.
author: Machel Shull, HAPPY SOUL: 10 Steps to Happiness

quote: While having information is a crucial first step, more information isn´t necessarily better. Take a look at your bookshelves and the list of seminars you have attended. If you have read more than one book about a subject or attended more than one seminar but still haven’t reached your goals, then your problem is not lack of information but rather lack of implementation.
author: Gudjon Bergmann
tags: doing, goal-setting, goals, implementation, information, information-overload

quote: The goal of comfort is at the self-same time the abandonment of great accomplishments.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: accomplishments, comfort, comfortable, ease, familiarity, goals, mediocrity, objectives, passive

quote: Win or lose, at least I'm doing something.
author: Mel Robbins, The 5 Second Rule: Transform Your Life, Work, and Confidence with Everyday Courage

quote: Sometimes you want something so badly, you get caught up; you lose yourself in that hunger. But then, once it is gone, you have a chance to reassess -to decide what it is you're truly after. Half of the time, it's not what you originally thought it would be.
author: Jenna Moreci, Eve: The Awakening

quote: It is not your talents that make you great, but your decisions.
author: Shannon L. Alder
tags: choose, choose-the-right, commonsense, decide, decisions, ego, goals, good-choices, humble, humility, integrity, talents

quote: People often overestimate what they can accomplish in one year. But they greatly underestimate what they could accomplish in five years.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Experience every failure closely because each failure is taking you closer to your goal and preparing you to be the unbeatable.
author: Mayur Ramgir

quote: There was this tendency to drift. And yet  when she thought about it, what did she really want to do? Or be? She had given up dancing-the dance-because it was too demanding, because it required an almost total devotion which she was unwilling to give. The cruelest art.
author: Edward Abbey, The Monkey Wrench Gang
tags: ambition, aspiration, conviction, drift, goals, life, plans

quote: Focus on your goals, if they make you happy then go for it!At times you may become depressed but keeping pushing forward, they're within reach!
author: M. Rose Bushéy

quote: The greatest of all human delusions is that there is a tangible goal, and not just direction towards an ideal aim. The idea that a goal can be attained perpetually frustrates human beings, who are disappointed at never getting there, never being able to stop.
author: Stephen Spender, World Within World: The Autobiography of Stephen Spender

quote: Due north’ on my compass is largely ‘due’ to the fact that in ‘due’ time I have been ‘unduly’ lax in recalibrating my compass. And I’m apparently ignorant enough to wonder why I’m lost.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: calibration, compass, destination, direction, fool, foolish, foolishness, goal, goals, ignorance, ignorant, journey, lost, map, misdirected, misled, stupid, wander, wandering

quote: The only difference between where you are and where you want to be is the number of steps you haven't taken yet.
author: Hayley Solich

quote: You know,” he continued reflectively, “there is something very satisfying about making something, creating it, modelling it on your dream and making that dream become a reality. Yes, we all have dreams. That's the easy bit. It's making them come real that's not so easy.
author: Leslie W.P. Garland, The Golden Tup
tags: dreaming, dreams-can-come-true, drrams, follow-your-dreams, following-your-dreams, goals, reaching-your-dreams, reaching-your-goals, real, satisfying, when-dreams-become-reality, when-dreams-come-true, working-towards-your-dreams

quote: If I’m chasing the wrong thing, what I’m chasing will end up chasing me. And in the end, I’m less likely to be the one doing the catching.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: catch, catching, chase, chased, chasing, choice, choices, decisions, desire, desiring, destination, error, flee, fleeing, flight, goal, goals, incorrect, misguided, misled, priorities, priority, pursuing, pursuit, retreat, retreating, wrong

quote: Make a list of things you like doing and then do them
author: Moonish Sood

quote: God will do everything possible to help you, to prepare you for what he had called you to do.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: When you overcome fear, you will be strengthened by faith
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: God needs your obedience
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Render unto God the things that are God’s
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: fulfillment, giving, goals, god, life, service

quote: Goals should be broken down into parts, and then think over the plan of their implementation
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: broken, fractions, goals, implementation, parts, plan

quote: You must consciously and carefully write out a plan of achieving your goals
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: achievement, careful, conscious, goals, plan, write

quote: Determine the actions you should do every day to achieve your goals
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Thus, in achieving ones goals, one improves, develops and discovers his potentials
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: abilities, achievement, development, discoveries, goals, improvement, potentials, self-discovery, talent

quote: A man going straight towards his goals overcomes difficulties and obstacles in his paths, and turns them into benefits
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: and-situation, challenges, difficulties, goals, man, obstacles, straight

quote: I'm sick and tired of having a forest and a torture chamber in my house... I want to have a nice quiet flat with ordinary doors and windows and a wife inside it, like anybody else!
author: Gaston Leroux, The Phantom of the Opera

quote: Perfection may be an island out of reach, but setting your sails toward it makes for a magnificent voyage.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
tags: go-far, goals, never-give-up, perfection, practice, practice-makes-perfect, reach-high, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, striving-for-perfection

quote: Goals are compulsive cahoots, gnawing at our minds everyday, challenging our abilities and pushing us closer to the curve of compliance.
author: Balroop Singh

quote: To reach a
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
tags: goal, goal-quotes, goals, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Our head is there to facilitate our coming to an understanding of our purpose and setting the necessary goals to achieve that purpose
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: It is the fool who declares ‘I am ascending the summit,’ while he’s toddling around in the ditch.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: ascend, ascending, denial, ditch, fool, fooled, foolish, goals, ignorant, lost, misdirected, objectives, stupid, toddling, wander, wandering

quote: Treasure the people who are willing and able to help you reach your goals.
author: Jeffrey Fry
tags: able, goals, help, people-willing, reach, treasure

quote: In my experience, there’s no secret to accomplishing almost any goal worth pursuing.
author: Lauren Graham, Talking as Fast as I Can: From Gilmore Girls to Gilmore Girls, and Everything in Between

quote: Without delayed gratification, goals are not achieved and objectives don’t get accomplished.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Self acceptance is one of the most difficult and one of the most rewarding goals you can accomplish.
author: Melchor Lim

quote: God has purpose for every man to fulfill certain tasks and attain concrete goals
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: attain, certain, concrete, fulfill, goals, god, man, purpose, task

quote: For a large majority of youth raised in church, the church has become irrelevant to their goals and pursuits in life
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Every time God gives you prosperity and favor to attain His goals and you do not use it, the devil will lead you in another way
author: Sunday Adelaja
tags: attain, devil, favor, goals, god, lead, prosperity, way

quote: Although I regularly convince myself otherwise, because I aim at something doesn’t necessarily mean I have a target.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: aim, aiming, aspirations, bulls-eye, calling, convince, convincing, goals, mission, objectives, target, targeting

quote: you can do anything if you put your focus on how to do it rather than on why you can't.
author: Bob Proctor

quote: We should always have a plan B, but at the same time, treat plan A like it were our only option.
author: Izey Victoria Odiase
tags: back-up, back-up-plan, back-up-plan-quotes, goals, goals-quotes, plan, plan-a, plan-ahead, plan-b, plan-quotes, plans

quote: It is quite possible that, even if you set the most relevant, realistic goals, you may not achieve them in the way or the time you wanted to. Life may throw something unexpected in your path, which stops you from achieving what you want, when you want. This is not failure. Feeling like you have failed is bound to lead to low mood, and can often come about if things haven't quite gone according to plan. However, the best thing to do is to draw a mental line under the experience, learn from what has happened and try again. As long as you are still trying, you are working towards your long-term aims; and as long as you are doing that, you are never truly failing.
author: Anna Barnes, How to Be Confident

quote: I am the Terrible Trivium, demon of petty tasks and worthless jobs, ogre of wasted effort, and monster of habit." The Humbug dropped his needle and stared in disbelief while Milo and Tock began to back away slowly. "Don't try to leave," he ordered, with a menacing sweep of his arm, "for there's so very much to do, and you still have over eight hundred years to go on the first job." "But why do only unimportant things?" asked Milo, who suddenly remembered how much time he spent each day doing them. "Think of all the trouble it saves," the man explained, and his face looked as if he'd be grinning an evil grin - if he could grin at all. "If you only do the easy and useless jobs, you'll never have to worry about the important ones which are so difficult. You just won't have the time. For there's always something to do to keep you from what you really should be doing, and if it weren't for that dreadful magic staff, you'd never know how much time you were wasting.
author: Norton Juster, The Phantom Tollbooth

quote: Most journeys are armchair calculations strategically charted in some reclined state that are designed to allow us to embark upon a grand journey without ever leaving the armchair. However, real journeys are absent of furniture.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: absent, chart, charted, destination, furniture, goal, goals, journey, laziness, lazy, mediocre, mediocrity, recline, reclined, strategic

quote: Every achievement worth remembering is stained with the blood of diligence and scarred by the wounds of disappointment
author: Charles Swindoll

quote: This mindset will eliminate any excuse and illuminate all possibilities. In the end, you will be liberated from fear and enthusiastically embrace a new form of living that will carry you to your goals.
author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

quote: The reward you get from a story is always less than you thought it would be, and the work is harder than you imagined. The point of a story is never about the ending, remember. It's about your character getting molded in the hard work of the middle. At some point the shore behind you stops getting smaller, and you paddle and wonder why the same strokes that used to move you now only rock the boat. You got the wife, but you don't know if you like her anymore and you've only been married for five years. You want to wake up and walk into the living room in your underwear and watch football and let your daughters play with the dog because the far shore doesn't get closer no matter how hard you paddle.The shore you left is just as distant, and there is no going back; there is only the decision to paddle in place or stop, slide out of the hatch, and sink into the sea. Maybe there's another story at the bottom of the sea. Maybe you don't have to be in this story anymore.
author: Donald Miller, A Million Miles in a Thousand Years: What I Learned While Editing My Life

quote: Words matter, choose the words you use to describe yourself carefully, make sure they reflect your desire. By our words we ask from God and command the Universe. Both always deliver what we ask
author: Val Uchendu
tags: desire-quotes, goals, god-quotes, power-of-words, purpose-quotes, words-quotes

quote: Of all the lists I’ve made of goals, and all the visions I’ve had, it never before occurred to me that I could be this specific, that I could aspire to a goal actually measurable in inches. I wonder if this is how successful people do it. I wonder if the difference between success and failure could more accurately be described in the waist sizes for jeans.
author: Lauren Graham, Someday, Someday, Maybe

quote: The reckoning is how we walk into our story; the rumble is where we own it. The goal of the rumble is to get honest about the stories we're making up about our struggles, to revisit, challenge, and reality-check these narratives.
author: Brené Brown, Rising Strong

quote: Numbers are important to the life, you better stay good at arithmetics.
author: Ahtizaz Wani

quote: A man is only as common as his dreams.
author: Harvey  Smith

quote: Find the small goals within your large goals, and work on them.
author: Kevin J. Donaldson

quote: Dig deep to finish what you start. Because no matter how hard it feels to push through adversity at the time, once your done, you'll own the experience for the rest of your life.
author: Aaron Lauritsen, 100 Days Drive: The Great North American Road Trip
tags: 100-days-drive, accomplishments, break-barriers, conquer-fear, determination, dig-deep, goals, pushing-through, resiliency

quote: No one HAS to do something he doesn’t want to do for the rest of his life. But then again, if that’s what you wind up doing, by all means convince yourself that you HAD to do it. You’ll have lots of company.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Lay out your options, dismiss the ones that are of zero appeal, and focus on those that not only excite you, but make sense to you.
author: Lauren Lola, An Absolute Mind

quote: Your first purpose is to find a purpose for yourself. And your second purpose must not immediately be trying to reach that purpose you found but to investigate thoroughly whether that purpose is really necessary for yourself or whether it is worth at all to struggle for it! Because millions are fighting for a purpose which will in no way make them happy at the end!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
tags: fight, fighting, goals, goals-in-life, happiness, happiness-quotations, ildan-wisdom, ildan-wise-sayings, ildan-words, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotations, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotes, purpose, purpose-driven-life, purpose-of-life, purpose-of-life-quotes, purpose-of-living, purpose-quotations, purpose-quotes, turkish-authors, turkish-literature, turkish-playwrights, turkish-quotations, turkish-quotes, turkish-wisdom-words, turkish-writers

quote: The barrier to our future is often the very plans that we’ve created to get there.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: barrier, barriers, create, created, goal, goals, maps, objective, objectives, obstacles, planning, plans, sabotage, self-sabotage, strategize, strategy, tactics, trajectory

quote: Life is not meant to be easy. But it can be simple.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: What are you waiting for tomorrow to do? To get done? To achieve? To start? Where your good intentions are disconnecting from the actions you should do for the things you desire?
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck
tags: achievement, desire, goals, success, today, tomorrow, waiting

quote: There are often two sets of goals in life: those that we establish, and those that really matter.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: authentic, calling, destination, establish, goal, goal-setting, goals, important, matter, mission, priorities, set, valuable, value

quote: Don't compete with other girls, complete goals.
author: Janna Cachola

quote: Regardless of the religious tradition, spiritual path, or personal perspective we choose to embrace, the potential exists for it to encourage and uplift every aspect of our being and to affect the types of goals we may choose to set for ourselves.
author: Laurie Buchanan, PhD

quote: When one person of whole nation fails to achieve his set goals, it influence the whole country.. That is why most of the countries are victim of terrorism, theft, snatching and etcetera
author: Faisal Nawaz Maitlo
tags: achieve, countries, fail, goals, nation, person, snatching, terrorism, theft, victim

quote: And we have the tools. We have the tools to choose. They are free, and within you now! It is the tool of conscious thought. Imagine your life and how it could be better if you used the power of conscious thought effectively?
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck
tags: action, consciousness, goals, life, love, success, tools, within

quote: If our lives are pleasing to Allah, and our goals are things which He approves then we can expect His Divine Assistance in accomplishing them, which includes Barakah in our time.
author: Abu Muawiyah Ismail Kamdar, Getting the Barakah: An Islamic Guide to Time Management

quote: The most critical time in any battle is not when I’m fatigued, it’s when I no longer care.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: accomplishments, achievements, attitude, battle, care, critical, defeat, fatigue, fortitude, goals, hopeless, hopelessness, life, success, surrender, tenacity, tired

quote: You're not given a big dream, without the ability to achieve it
author: Jana Kingsford

quote: The best stories are about a character who has a goal or noble quest and goes through hell to get it. Do you have a goal or quest like that in real life? Why not?
author: Kenneth Wayne Wood

quote: The human animal needs something to aspire to, somewhere to go and something to do.
author: Jamey Glasnovic, Lost and Found: Adrift in the Canadian Rockies

quote: Happiness can be defined as the function of the effort we put forth toward the realization of life's goals. When we understand that our purpose in this world is to strive toward purposeful accomplishment, precisely then will we experience happiness.
author: H.W. Charles, The Money Code: Become a Millionaire With the Ancient Jewish Code

quote: If you have more dreams than achievements-you're young.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: Happiness does not result from pleasure, but rather, from reaching one's goals.
author: H.W. Charles, The Money Code: Become a Millionaire With the Ancient Jewish Code

quote: When you engage in people pleasing you are out of integrity with yourself, your goals, your dreams and your life’s mission.
author: Eileen Anglin

quote: Goals want to be realized as soon as they're created.
author: Zoltan Andrejkovics, The Invisible Game: The Mindset of a Winning Team

quote: Your image is your brand and you have only one opportunity to make that first impression. Choose to make a positive first impression.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today
tags: branding, charisma, confidence, goals, hope, motivational, positivity, respect, style, wisdom

quote: Do not envy the success of any person. But set your goal on a successful guy. Then this will make you succeed.

quote: Project a confident image through good body posture.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today
tags: branding, charisma, confidence, goals, hope, motivational, positivity, respect, style, wisdom

quote: Stand tall and be proud. Realize confidence is charismatic and something that is something money can't buy, it radiates from within you.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today

quote: To get it doneand see it thru,find less to sayand more to do.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
tags: accomplish, achieve, achievement-quotes, do-it, goal-quotes, goals, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The height of your accomplishments is determined by the depth of your convictions.
author: William F. Scolavino

quote: Take time to define your own goals and stay focused on achieving them. You're your own competition.
author: K.J. Kilton

quote: The presence of a path doesn’t necessarily mean the existence of a destination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: calling, destination, goal, goals, journey, mission, mistaken, path, road

quote: Set goals and accomplish them.
author: Sharfaraz Ahmed

quote: A core group of guys, all sharing similar goals, can move mountains.
author: Chris Matakas, The Tao of Jiu Jitsu

quote: The most meaningful endeavors are the ones that come without an end.
author: Chris Matakas, The Tao of Jiu Jitsu

quote: Are your goals backed by burning desire or are you giving the Universe mixed signals?
author: Azim Jamal & Brian Tracy, What You Seek Is Seeking You

quote: What we seek is never what we seek. That is why we may not recognize that we've found what we truly yearn for.
author: Renzo Dante (Saligiare)

quote: My goal has been willing to kiss my feet.
author: Tanmaya Guru

quote: I thought myself sufficiently shrewd to make whatever decisions I wanted to make, and then to be able to sufficiently steer those decisions away from the rather dark and nasty places they would naturally take me. And I stand oddly perplexed that suddenly everything around me is dark and nasty.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: dark, decisions, desires, direct, ego, egotism, egotistical, foolish, foolishness, goals, nasty, objectives, passions, steer, wisdom

quote: A great attitude toward your approach to an interview—demonstrated by your good posture—is everything.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today
tags: branding, charisma, confidence, goals, hope, motivational, positivity, respect, style, wisdom

quote: It does not take the striking pose of a high-fashion model or the strict stance of someone in uniform to earn respect and admiration.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today
tags: branding, charisma, confidence, goals, hope, motivational, positivity, respect, style, wisdom

quote: Healthy posture is based on natural positions that balance and support your skeletal system’s curves and weight-bearing abilities against the force of gravity.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today

quote: Our preoccupation with goals, results, and the quick fix has separated us from our own experiences.
author: George Leonard, Mastery: The Keys to Success and Long-Term Fulfillment

quote: Take your time, but don't waste your time. There's a difference.
author: Philip Wang

quote: The biggest payoff in achieving a goal is not what you get, but who you've become.
author: Joan Posivy

quote: Posture Power, when interviewing for a job remember. Poor posture shows uncertainty and a lack of confidence and ability. Good posture conveys confidence and an air of capability.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today

author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today

author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today

quote: Good posture can be beneficial to your health.
author: Cindy Ann Peterson, My Style, My Way: Top Experts Reveal How to Create Yours Today
